title: Review: Cholombian – Before You, It Never Snowed EP
content:
With the likes of Bondax and Disclosure causing serious waves in the UK music scene, it would appear that now is as good a time as any for young, talented producers to forge a name for themselves.

Southampton’s Cholombian aka Mitchell Stevens may still be simmering beneath the radar of most people, but it’s surely only a question of time before others pick up on his ambient electronica. Having Introduced Stevens toward the tail end of last year, he’s increased his fanbase with the release of two EP’s, March’s Distance and last weeks Before You, It Never Snowed.

Switching from drone based soundscapes to sampling mid-00’s Usher within the space of seconds, (You Don’t Even Know What You’ve Done), it’s within Cholombian’s flexibility that he really excels, toying with complex beat structures and dark, industrial synth sounds. Kiss The Ring finds him borrowing vocal samples again, this time from Wu Tang, before the track descends into a mirage of atmospheric, metallic claps. Whilst it’s still early days for Cholombian, he’s rapidly building up a mightily impressive catalog of work. Check out the full EP below.
